en: It goes without saying that autumn is the best season for taking long walks in the country.

en: The prime minister's remark sparked the opposition movement.
zh: 总理的话引发了反对运动。

en: The prime minister's answer was equivocal.
zh: 总理的回答模棱两可。

en: The news of the prime minister's resignation took us by surprise.
zh: 总理辞职的消息让我们大吃一惊。

en: The Prime Minister's speech was calculated to anger the opposition parties.
zh: 总理的演讲显然是故意要激怒反对党。

en: The prime minister's speech did not make for peace.
zh: 总理的讲话对和平没有什么帮助。

en: The Prime Minister's explanation of the scandal just wouldn't wash with the public.
zh: 总理对丑闻的解释，公众根本不买账。

en: The premier and his cabinet colleagues resigned.
zh: 总理和他的内阁成员一起辞职了。

en: Word is passing that the Prime Minister is seriously ill.
zh: 有传言说总理病得很重。

en: The prime minister appoints the members of his cabinet.
zh: 总理任命内阁成员。

en: The Prime Minister tried to cover up the scandal, but that just made it worse when the newspapers discovered the truth.
zh: 总理试图掩盖丑闻，结果报社发现真相后反而把事情闹得更大了。

en: I sprained my neck while sleeping.
zh: 我睡觉把脖子给睡落枕了。

en: I woke up with a crick in my neck.
zh: 我一觉醒来脖子落枕了。

en: They communicate disapproval by shaking their heads.
zh: 他们用摇头来表示不赞成。

en: The sun beat down on our necks and backs.
zh: 太阳直射在我们的脖子和后背上。

en: I'm up to my neck in work.
zh: 我工作忙得不可开交。

en: His head nodded, and he snored gently.
zh: 他打着瞌睡，轻声打起了呼噜。

en: I have a rash on my neck.
zh: 我脖子上起了皮疹。

en: No one dares to contradict his employer for fear of being fired.
zh: 没人敢顶撞老板，生怕被炒鱿鱼。

en: I can't turn my neck, because it hurts a lot.
zh: 我脖子疼得转不动。

en: Don't drive under the influence of alcohol.
zh: 别酒后驾车。

en: Don't drink and drive.
zh: 喝酒不开车，开车不喝酒。

en: Don't drive under the influence of drink.
zh: 不要酒后开车。

en: I bought a bottle of beer at the liquor store.
zh: 我在商店买了一瓶啤酒。

en: Drink less and sleep more.
zh: 少喝酒，多睡觉。

en: It is a toss-up whether to drink sake or whiskey; too much of either results equally in drunken revelry.
zh: 喝清酒还是威士忌都差不多，喝多了都会发酒疯。

en: I advise you to give up drinking.
zh: 我建议你把酒戒了。

en: Try to be moderate in drinking.
zh: 喝酒要适度。

en: Too much drinking will make you sick.
zh: 酒喝多了伤身体。

en: He was sitting drinking wine.
zh: 他正坐着喝酒呢。

en: I drank too much and was unsteady on my feet.
zh: 我喝多了，走路直晃。

en: If he continues drinking too much, he will fall ill sooner or later.
zh: 他要是再这么喝下去，早晚得病。

en: Both drinking and smoking are bad for the health.
zh: 抽烟喝酒对身体都有害。

en: Both drinking and smoking are bad for your health.
zh: 抽烟喝酒都伤身体。

en: We make sake from rice.
zh: 我们用大米酿清酒。

en: It's best to drink in moderation.
zh: 喝酒最好适量。

en: The drunken man grasped my collar and swore at me.
zh: 那醉汉揪着我的领子骂我。

en: Bacchus has drowned more men than Neptune.
zh: 淹死在酒杯里的人比淹死在大海里的还多。

en: Don't indulge yourself too much in drinking.
zh: 别太贪杯。

en: You must not get drowned in your sake.
zh: 你千万不能沉溺于酒精。

en: Drink brought about his downfall.
zh: 酒把他给毁了。

en: Let's have a drink or something.
zh: 咱们去喝一杯什么的吧。

en: When the wine is in, the wit is out.
zh: 只要酒一下肚，人就糊涂了。

en: When wine is in, truth is out.
zh: 酒后吐真言。

en: Where the drink goes in, there the wit goes out.
zh: 酒杯一端，理智全关。

en: You must not yield to your desire to drink.
zh: 你得克制住酒瘾。

en: He who loves not wine, woman and songs, remains a fool his whole life long.
zh: 不爱美酒、美女和音乐的人，一辈子都是个傻瓜。

en: Hobbies take your mind off the worries of everyday life.
zh: 兴趣爱好能让你忘掉生活中的烦恼。

en: There is no disputing about tastes.
zh: 萝卜青菜，各有所爱。

en: What do you do for fun?
zh: 你平时都玩点儿什么？

en: What's your hobby?
zh: 你的爱好是什么？

en: What are your hobbies?
zh: 你都有什么爱好？

en: What is your hobby?
zh: 你的兴趣是什么？

en: My hobby is playing golf.
zh: 我的爱好是打高尔夫。

en: I play the guitar in my spare time.
zh: 我空闲时间会弹吉他。

en: When talking about his hobby, he always puts on a serious expression.
zh: 一说起他的爱好，他就一脸严肃。

en: It is not easy to combine hobbies with profits.
zh: 想要把爱好和赚钱结合起来并不容易。

en: Speaking of hobbies, I'm fond of baseball.
zh: 说到爱好，我挺喜欢棒球的。

en: Speaking of hobbies, do you collect stamps?
zh: 说到爱好，你集邮吗？

en: If one does not have a hobby, his life may be desolate.
zh: 如果没点爱好，生活会很枯燥。

en: The seeds will become flowers in the summer.
zh: 种子夏天就会开花。

en: As you sow, so will you reap.
zh: 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。

en: Cover the seeds with a little earth.
zh: 在种子上盖层薄土。

en: Seeds must have air and water to grow.
zh: 种子生长需要空气和水。

en: The hunter was alert to every sound and movement.
zh: 猎人对周围的一举一动都很警觉。

en: The hunters trailed the deer over the mountain.
zh: 猎人翻山越岭地追踪那只鹿。

en: Spring over the ground like a hunting hound.
zh: 像猎犬一样在地上跳。

en: He who touches pitch shall be defiled therewith.
zh: 近墨者黑。

en: Wounded bears are usually very dangerous.
zh: 受伤的熊通常很危险。

en: Magicians use deception.
zh: 魔术师用的都是障眼法。

en: No matter how interesting magic shows may be, I don't like them so much.
zh: 不管魔术多好看，我也没那么喜欢。

en: He works fast and is very articulate but his insincerity is his biggest defect.
zh: 他干活利索，口才也好，但最大的缺点就是不真诚。

en: I read novels at random.
zh: 我看小说挺随性的。

en: You had better stop buying things at random.
zh: 你最好别再乱买东西了。

en: It is better to read a few books carefully than to read many at random.
zh: 与其乱读很多书，不如精读几本。

en: I helped her into a gown.
zh: 我帮她穿上了礼服。

en: It's very nice of you to help me.
zh: 你能帮我真是太好了。

en: Let me do this.
zh: 让我来吧。

en: Will you please help me?
zh: 能帮我个忙吗？

en: I gave him three textbooks in exchange for his help.
zh: 为了谢他帮忙，我送了他三本教科书。

en: Do you want me to give you a hand?
zh: 要帮忙吗？

en: I'll treat you to dinner if you help me.
zh: 你要是帮我，我就请你吃晚饭。

en: We need someone to help us.
zh: 我们需要有人来帮下忙。

en: Can you help me? I can't make out how to start this machine.
zh: 能帮我一下吗？我搞不懂这机器怎么开。

en: I'd like to treat you to lunch to thank you for all your help.
zh: 谢谢你帮了这么多忙，我想请你吃个午饭。

en: Can I help?
zh: 我能帮上忙吗？

en: Do you want me to help?
zh: 你需要我帮忙吗？

en: You don't have to help me.
zh: 你不用帮我。

en: Let me help you. Your bag looks very heavy.
zh: 我来帮你吧，你的包看着挺沉的。

en: Let me give you a hand.
zh: 我来帮你一把。

en: I bought him a drink in return for his help.
zh: 为了谢谢他帮忙，我请他喝了一杯。

en: I bought him a drink to thank him for his help.
zh: 我请他喝了一杯，感谢他帮我。

en: Will you lend me the books by Osame Tezuka for about a week?
zh: 手冢治虫的书能借我用个一星期吗？

en: Would you write your name in my notebook?
zh: 能在我的笔记本上签个名吗？

en: That's it in brief.
zh: 简单来说就是这样。

en: To put it briefly, she turned down his proposal.
zh: 简而言之，她拒绝了他的求婚。

en: To make a long story short, we cannot accept your offer.
zh: 长话短说，我们没法接受你的提议。

en: The project, in short, was a failure.
zh: 总之，这个项目失败了。

en: To put it briefly it's your fault.
zh: 简单说吧，这就是你的错。

en: To make a long story short, we buried the hatchet.
zh: 长话短说，我们和好了。

en: Please confine yourself to a short comment.
zh: 请简短地评论一下。

en: A pair of gloves is a nice gift.
zh: 送副手套是个不错的礼物。

en: I'd like to check in.
zh: 我想办入住。

en: I got out of bed and had a good stretch.
zh: 我起床伸了个大大的懒腰。

en: My hands and legs are swollen.
zh: 我的手和腿都肿了。

en: My hands and feet have got as cold as ice.
zh: 我的手脚冰凉。

en: I am interested in palm reading.
zh: 我对手相挺感兴趣。

en: Pull it open.
zh: 把它拉开。

en: Is there a handling charge?
zh: 要收手续费吗？

en: How much is the commission?
zh: 佣金是多少？

en: How much is the handling charge?
zh: 手续费多少钱？

en: We charge a commission of 3%.
zh: 我们收3%的手续费。

en: Learn a trade.
zh: 学门手艺。

en: I will be happy to assist whoever needs help.
zh: 谁需要帮忙我都很乐意。

en: Written by hand, the letter was not very easy to read.
zh: 信是手写的，不太好认。

en: Let's do this as a first step.
zh: 我们先走这一步吧。

en: Her condition is taking a turn for the better after the operation.
zh: 动完手术后，她的情况好转了。

en: Her condition is improving after the operation.
zh: 手术后，她的病情在好转。

en: I am still a bit sore after my operation.
zh: 动完手术后，我还有点疼。

en: Will surgery help it?
zh: 动手术管用吗？

en: You have to have an operation.
zh: 你得动个手术。

en: The operation cannot wait.
zh: 手术不能再拖了。

en: I don't want to have an operation.
zh: 我不想动手术。

en: He had an injection prior to the operation.
zh: 他在手术前打了一针。

en: Do I need an operation?
zh: 我需要动手术吗？

en: Surgery is the best solution.
zh: 动手术是最好的办法。

en: I converted my yen into dollars.
zh: 我把日元换成了美元。

en: I have no money with me.
zh: 我身上没带钱。

en: Write me sometime, OK?
zh: 有空给我写信哦。

en: Please remember to post the letter.
zh: 记得寄信哦。

en: Please don't forget to put the letter into the mailbox.
zh: 别忘了把信投进邮筒。

en: As soon as she read the letter, she began to cry.
zh: 她一读信就开始哭了。

en: Please send the letter by express.
zh: 请寄特快专递。

en: Do you think I should write?
zh: 你觉得我该写信吗？

en: The best way to write letters is to put down whatever is in your mind.
zh: 写信最好的办法就是想到什么写什么。

en: Don't forget to write to me.
zh: 别忘了给我写信。

en: All you have to do in writing is to keep it clear and interesting.
zh: 写信只要写得清楚有趣就行。

en: It is no easy task to write a letter.
zh: 写封信真不容易。

en: I wonder whether to write or phone.
zh: 我在想是写信还是打电话。

en: I've finished writing the letter.
zh: 我写完信了。

en: After I write the letter, I'll mail it in a mailbox.
zh: 写完信后我会把它投进邮筒。

en: I have to write a letter, but I won't be able to get at it until tomorrow.
zh: 我得写封信，但明天才能动笔。

en: Please wait until I have finished writing this letter.
zh: 请等我把信写完。

en: I'm busy with writing letters and giving speeches.
zh: 我正忙着写信和做演讲。

en: If you have written the letter, I'll post it.
zh: 信写好了的话，我帮你寄。

en: I forgot to put on the stamp before I mailed the letter.
zh: 寄信前我忘了贴邮票。

en: Please remind me to post the letters.
zh: 记得提醒我寄信。

en: I remember that a letter is sent.
zh: 我记得有一封信寄出去了。

en: I remember mailing the letter.
zh: 我记得寄过那封信了。

en: Let me hear from you.
zh: 记得给我回信。

en: Please send me a letter.
zh: 请给我寄封信。

en: You must not write a letter with a pencil.
zh: 不能用铅笔写信。

en: The letter will arrive tomorrow.
zh: 信明天到。

en: Letters are delivered every day.
zh: 每天都有信送。

en: The letter was written by her.
zh: 这封信是她写的。

en: Did you receive my letter?
zh: 你收到我的信了吗？

en: The letter was written.
zh: 信写好了。

en: Letters are a link with friends who live far away.
zh: 信件是和远方朋友联系的纽带。

en: The letter will arrive in a week or so.
zh: 信大概一周左右到。

en: Write your letters with a pen.
zh: 用钢笔写信。

en: I used to type my letters, but now I use a word processor.
zh: 我以前都是用打字机写信，现在用文字处理软件了。

en: Don't put off answering the letter.
zh: 别拖着不回信。

en: I've got no answer to my letter.
zh: 我的信还没收到回音。

en: Have you had an answer?
zh: 你收到回信了吗？

en: Have you received an answer to your letter?
zh: 你收到那封信的回音了吗？

en: The letter runs as follows.
zh: 信上是这么写的。

en: The contents of the letter were secret.
zh: 这封信的内容是秘密。

en: Her duties include making copies of letters.
zh: 她的工作包括复印信件。

en: Don't forget to put a stamp on your letter.
zh: 别忘了给信贴邮票。

en: You must reply to that letter.
zh: 你一定要回那封信。

en: You have to reply to the letter.
zh: 你得回这封信。

en: Please contact me by letter.
zh: 请写信跟我联系。

en: Please contact me by mail.
zh: 请邮寄联系我。

en: Drop me a line and let me know what you think.
zh: 给我写封信，说说你的想法。

en: Treated roughly, the cup has some cracks.
zh: 因为用得太粗鲁，杯子都有裂纹了。

en: We should take the necessary steps before it's too late.
zh: 我们得趁还来得及，采取必要措施。

en: We have ample funds in hand.
zh: 我们手头资金充裕。

en: Watch your fingers!
zh: 小心你的手！

en: This is all the money I have.
zh: 这就是我所有的钱了。

en: Let's make believe we have one million yen hand.
zh: 咱们假装手里有一百万日元吧。

en: The bill is due on the 1st of next month.
zh: 账单下个月一号到期。

en: Where are the luggage carts?
zh: 行李推车在哪儿？

en: I will be waiting for you at baggage claim.
zh: 我在行李提取处等你。

en: Where do I go after I pick up my baggage?
zh: 取完行李后我该往哪儿走？

en: Where can I check my baggage?
zh: 我在哪儿可以托运行李？

en: This is all my carry-on baggage.
zh: 这些全都是我的随身行李。

en: We limit baggage to ten kilograms each.
zh: 我们的行李限重是每人十公斤。

en: A wheelbarrow fills the bill for moving concrete blocks.
zh: 搬水泥块用独轮车正合适。

en: Get your hands off!
zh: 把手拿开！

en: Take your hands off me.
zh: 把手从我身上拿开。

en: Don't let go.
zh: 别松手。

en: Keep your hand still.
zh: 手别动。

en: Don't let go. Hold on tight.
zh: 别松手，抓紧了。

en: We'll help you, okay?
zh: 我们会帮你的，好吗？

en: Put your hands behind your head.
zh: 把手抱在头后面。

en: Hey, could you give me a hand over here, please?
zh: 嘿，能过来帮我一下吗？

en: Give me a hand. If you do, I'll buy you a drink later.
zh: 帮我个忙，回头请你喝酒。

en: Lend me a hand.
zh: 搭把手。

en: Come here after you have washed your hands.
zh: 洗完手再过来。

en: Wash your hands.
zh: 去洗手。

en: I reached for and tapped his shoulder.
zh: 我伸手拍了拍他的肩膀。

en: I reached out and tapped him on the shoulder.
zh: 我伸手拍了拍他的肩膀。

en: I reached out and tapped his shoulder.
zh: 我伸手拍了拍他的肩膀。

en: Don't touch.
zh: 别碰。

en: Don't put out your hand.
zh: 别伸手。

en: You'd better back off.
zh: 你最好退后。

en: Wash your hands well.
zh: 把手好好洗洗。

en: They waved good-bye with their hands.
zh: 他们挥手告别。

en: Did you wash your hands?
zh: 你洗手了吗？

en: We must keep our hands clean.
zh: 我们必须保持手干净。

en: Raise your hand before you answer.
zh: 回答问题前请先举手。

en: Put your hands up!
zh: 举起手来！

en: I can't get anywhere with it.
zh: 这事儿我一点儿进展也没有。

en: Do you have a pencil about you?
zh: 你身上带铅笔了吗？

en: It is necessary to fight AIDS with whatever weapons are at hand.
zh: 必须利用手头的一切手段来对抗艾滋病。

en: I have done everything I could do.
zh: 我已经尽力了。

en: Those who bring something with them are welcome.
zh: 带了东西来的都欢迎。

en: Hands reveal our inward emotions.
zh: 手能流露出内心的情感。

en: Are your hands free of dirt?
zh: 你的手干净吗？

en: You must keep your hands clean.
zh: 你得保持手干净。

en: Show your cards.
zh: 亮牌吧。

en: You should lay your cards out on the table.
zh: 你应该摊牌。

en: Lay your cards on the table and give me a straight answer!
zh: 摊牌吧，给我个痛快话！

en: Don't show them your hand.
zh: 别让他们看到你的底牌。

en: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
zh: 一鸟在手胜过双鸟在林。

en: A bird in the hand is better than two in the bush.
zh: 一鸟在手胜过双鸟在林。

en: There's nothing to be done about it.
zh: 这事儿没辙了。

en: What is it you got?
zh: 你手里拿的是什么？

en: It's too much of a nuisance.
zh: 这太麻烦了。

en: Give me what you have in your hand.
zh: 把你手里的东西给我。

en: I couldn't get it.
zh: 我没搞到。

en: My hands are stained with paint.
zh: 我手上沾了油漆。

en: Tell me what you have in your hand.
zh: 告诉我你手里拿的是什么。

en: I haven't got much money with me.
zh: 我身上没带多少钱。

en: I don't have much money on me.
zh: 我身上钱不多。

en: I don't have a lot of money on me.
zh: 我身上没多少钱。

en: Hold the handrail.
zh: 扶好扶手。

en: Hold on to the rail.
zh: 抓稳扶手。

en: I pricked up my ears when I heard of the available apartment.
zh: 一听说有空房，我立马竖起了耳朵。

en: I can't reach it.
zh: 我够不着。

en: My hands are dirty. I have been repairing my bicycle.
zh: 我手脏，刚修了自行车。

en: You should not allow him to get out of your hand.
zh: 你不该让他从你手里溜掉。

en: Even if he has a clue, he won't let you know it.
zh: 就算他有线索，也不会告诉你的。

en: The plate slipped from my hands and fell to the floor.
zh: 盘子从我手里滑掉，摔地上了。

en: My fingers are so numb with cold that I can't play the piano.
zh: 我手指冻僵了，弹不了钢琴。

en: The garrison was forced to surrender.
zh: 守军被迫投降了。

en: I was challenged by a gatekeeper.
zh: 我被看门的给拦住了。

en: Don't make a promise which you cannot keep.
zh: 做不到的事别乱答应。

en: Don't make promises you can't keep.
zh: 别许下你兑现不了的诺言。

en: Don't make promises that you can't keep.
zh: 别许下你做不到的承诺。

en: The Board of Directors aim is to make decisions regarding business affairs of the company.
zh: 董事会就是负责定公司业务的事儿。

en: The business contract ran out last month.
zh: 合同上个月到期了。

en: It was so cold that he was shivering.

en: Some people are up to their necks in debt.

en: I'd like to see the car before I rent it.

en: Do not interfere!

en: They are in the way.

en: It's a distraction.

en: You get in my way?

en: The faucet is leaking.

en: She screamed when she saw a snake.

en: The snake shed its skin.

en: They that hide can find.

en: The snake swallowed a frog.

en: Wheels turn on axles.

en: The wheels turned around.

en: I've just oiled the wheels.

en: The wheel began to turn.
zh: 轮子开始转了。

en: Around him, in the carriage, the other passengers rocked and swayed.

en: Barricades across driveways say "Keep Out."

en: Don't you tend to get carsick?

en: You will save yourself a lot of time if you take the car.

en: You'll save yourself a lot of time if you take the car.
zh: 开车能帮你省不少时间。

en: Selling motorcars is my business.

en: Selling cars is my job.

en: Selling cars is my business.

en: I can't afford to buy a car.

en: See the car carefully before you buy it.

en: You should inspect the car well before you buy it.
zh: 买车之前你应该好好检查一下。

en: Reckon the cost before you decide to purchase the car.

en: I want to rent a car, please show me a price list.

en: Move your car, please.
zh: 请挪一下你的车。

en: I had my car stolen.

en: The car was stolen.

en: With the car stolen, there was nothing for it but to walk.

en: Can I borrow your car?

en: Put the car into the garage.

en: The man washing the car is Mr Jones.
zh: 那个洗车的人是琼斯先生。

en: The boy washing the car is my brother.

en: The man washing the car is Mr. Jones.
zh: 正在洗车的那个男人是琼斯先生。

en: It cost me a fortune to get my car repaired.
zh: 修车花了我一大笔钱。

en: It cost a lot of money to repair the car.

en: It cost me three hundred dollars to have my car repaired.

en: It cost $300 to get the car fixed.

en: Can we rent a car?

en: May I borrow your car?

en: I would like to rent a car.

en: Keeping a car is a considerable expense.

en: How many cars do you have?

zh: 我把旧车卖了换了辆新的。

en: Check and adjust the brakes before you drive.
zh: 开车前先检查并调整一下刹车。

en: People who drive cars should wear seat belts.
zh: 开车的人应该系好安全带。

en: Drivers should always be on their guard against accidents.
zh: 开车的时候得随时留神，防止出事故。

en: You must take care when you drive a car.
zh: 开车的时候一定要小心。

en: You must be careful when you drive a car.
zh: 开车时一定要留神。

en: You should be careful when you drive a car.
zh: 开车应该小心点。

en: You can't be too careful when you drive a car.

en: It is necessary to have a license to drive a car.

en: You need a license to drive a car.

en: It is a lot of fun to drive a car.

en: Keep to the left when driving.

en: When you are driving, you should slow down on corners.

en: A big tree had fallen across the road and was in my way as I drove.
zh: 一棵大树倒在路中间，挡住了我的去路。

en: The man driving the car had been drinking.
zh: 那个开车的人喝酒了。

en: That salesman was persistent in asking me to buy a car.

en: Running a car is a great expense.

en: Would you move your car, please?

en: Few people have two cars.

en: A few people have two cars.
zh: 有少数人有两辆车。

en: There are two or three persons with two cars.
zh: 有两三个人有两辆车。

en: It's the law: always buckle your safety belt in cars and airplanes.
zh: 法律规定：在汽车和飞机上都要系好安全带。

en: Cars, buses, and trucks are all vehicles.

en: The car ran into a tree.

en: The car clapped along very slowly.

en: The car behaved well.

en: The car hit a telephone pole.

en: Our car pulled uphill.

en: The car ran at 40 miles an hour.

en: A car is a handy thing to own.

en: The automobile is of great use in our life.

en: Cars are indispensable to suburban life.

en: The car cut to the left.

en: The car ran down the hill.

en: The car came to a smooth stop.

en: The car ran along the shore.

en: The car brushed the fence and got scratched.

en: The car drew in to let the truck pass.

en: Was there anything wrong with the car?

en: Cars go through the tunnel.
zh: 汽车穿过隧道。

en: Our car broke down on our way there.
zh: 我们的车在半路上坏了。

en: The car continued to put on speed.
zh: 车子还在继续提速。

en: The car continued to pick up speed.
zh: 车速还在不断加快。

en: The automobile is a wonderful invention.
zh: 汽车是一项伟大的发明。

en: The car veered from its course.

en: The car gave a jolt.
zh: 车子猛地颠了一下。

en: The car is kept in a garage, under cover and locked.
zh: 车停在车库里，盖着车罩并锁好了。

en: The car crashed into the guard-rail and rolled down the hill.

en: The car ran into a guardrail.

en: When should I return the car?

en: You should always keep your car in good order.

en: I'm going to go and get my driver's license.

en: A car licence can be held from age 18.

en: You can get a car license after you turn eighteen.

en: Car exhaust causes serious pollution in towns.

en: Exhaust gases of a car are noxious.

en: What is the matter with your car?

en: It was careless of you to leave the key in your car.
zh: 你太粗心了，竟然把钥匙留在车里了。

en: Are there any pens in the car?

en: With car prices so high, now is the worst time to buy.

en: I paid fifty percent down for the car.
zh: 买这辆车我付了五成首付。

zh: 车款将分12个月付清。

en: Be alert when you cross a busy street!

en: Traffic noise is very harsh to the ear.

en: The traffic noise interfered with my sleep.

en: Could you open the car window?

en: The front windshield of a car was smashed to pieces.

en: I could see traffic lights ahead of my car.

en: It is difficult to catch up with Japan in the production of cars.
zh: 汽车产量很难赶上日本。

en: The number of cars is on the increase.
zh: 汽车的数量正在增加。

en: There were three deaths in the car crash.

en: What have you done about fixing the car?

zh: 车修好后请告诉我费用，我会把钱寄给你。

en: The existing law concerning car accidents requires amending.

en: They were badly injured in a car accident.

en: I have left my car keys behind.

en: I've been learning to drive.

en: It took me some time to learn how to drive a car.
zh: 我学开车花了不少时间。

en: Driving a car taxes the eyes.
zh: 开车挺费眼的。

en: Driving a car is a lot of fun.
zh: 开车很有意思。

en: Do you know how to drive a car?
zh: 你会开车吗？

en: Drive carefully.
zh: 开车小心点。

en: How I wished I could drive a car!
zh: 我多希望我会开车啊！

en: Look at the boy beside the car.
zh: 看看车旁边的那个小男孩。

en: I have to charge the battery of my car.
zh: 我得给车电瓶充个电。

en: The car battery is dead.
zh: 车电瓶没电了。

en: My car battery is dead.
zh: 我车没电了。

en: I was unable to write down the number of the car.
zh: 我没来得及记下那辆车的车牌号。

en: Military personnel are prime targets of car salespeople.
zh: 军人是汽车销售的主要目标群体。

en: I have a problem with my car.
zh: 我的车出了点毛病。

en: Instead of putting the car into gear, she put it into reverse, causing a great deal of damage to the store-front.
zh: 她没挂前进挡反而挂了倒挡，结果把店面撞得一塌糊涂。

en: I've lost my car key.
zh: 我车钥匙丢了。

en: I can't get the car to start.
zh: 车打不着火。

en: The car failing to start, we went by bus.
zh: 因为车打不着火，我们就坐公交去了。

en: I narrowly escaped being run over by a car.
zh: 我差点被车给撞了。

en: I was almost hit by a car.
zh: 我刚才差点被车撞到。

en: I spend all her money on the car.
zh: 我把她的钱全花在车上了。

en: Don't you have a phone in your car?

en: Look out for the car.
zh: 小心车。

en: I asked if you wanted a ride.
zh: 我问你想不想搭便车。

en: Get into the car.
zh: 上车吧。

en: I was wondering if you could give me a lift.
zh: 我在想你能不能捎我一段。

en: Will you give me a ride?
zh: 你能捎我一程吗？

en: Could you give me a lift in your car?
zh: 能让我搭一下你的车吗？

en: I'll give you a lift.
zh: 我捎你一段吧。

en: Why don't you give me a ride?
zh: 你干嘛不捎我一程呢？

en: Can I give you a ride?
zh: 要我捎你一段吗？

en: I signaled the car to go slow.
zh: 我示意那辆车开慢点。

en: Didn't you lock up your car?
zh: 你没锁车吗？

en: I'll give you a ride.
zh: 我送你一趟吧。

en: Is there any room to spare in your car?
zh: 你车里还有空座吗？

en: Lots of people are interested in cars, but they're really nothing to me.
zh: 很多人对车感兴趣，但我真的无感。

en: Could you carry it to the car?

en: Nothing is the matter with the car. It's just that you are a bad driver.
zh: 车没坏，是你技术不行。

en: There was room for one person in the car.
zh: 车里还能坐一个人。

en: A car has one steering wheel.
zh: 车只有一个方向盘。

en: It was careless of you to leave the key in the car.
zh: 你太粗心了，竟然把钥匙落在车里了。

en: When I passed by it in a car, I caught a glimpse of the house of a famous actress.
zh: 我开车经过时，瞥见了一位著名女演员的房子。

en: I caught a glimpse of the house of a famous actress when I passed by it in a car.
zh: 我开车路过的时候，瞥见了一个名演员的家。

en: Let's go by car.
zh: 咱们开车去吧。

en: My neck snapped when my car was hit from behind.
zh: 我的车被追尾时，我的脖子扭到了。

en: Please come to pick me up.
zh: 请来接我一下。

en: He went to Kyoto by car.
zh: 他开车去了京都。

en: I went to Kyoto by car.
zh: 我开车去了京都。

en: I've been to the seaside by car.
zh: 我开车去过海边。

en: Will you drive me home?
zh: 你能开车送我回家吗？

en: Another ten minutes drive will take you to the seashore.
zh: 再开车走个十分钟就到海边了。

en: Could you tell me how to get to your office?
zh: 能告诉我怎么去你办公室吗？

en: How long does it take by car?
zh: 开车去要多久？

en: It only takes thirty minutes by car.
zh: 开车只要半个小时。

en: It took me an hour and a half to get there by car.
zh: 我开车去那儿花了一个半小时。

en: I want a car, but I have no money to buy one.
zh: 我想买辆车，但没钱买。

en: I want a car, but I don't have money to buy one.
zh: 我想买车，可我没钱买。

en: The car bumped the tree.
zh: 车撞到树上了。

en: A car went by at terrific speed.
zh: 一辆车飞快地开了过去。

en: There were cars burning, people dying, and nobody could help them.
zh: 汽车在着火，人也快不行了，可没人能帮得了他们。

en: It was frightful when my car skidded on the ice.
zh: 我的车在冰上打滑的时候，真的吓死我了。

en: A car was blocking the gateway.
zh: 有辆车把大门口给堵住了。

en: A car drew up at the main gate.

en: Cars took the place of bicycles.

zh: 如果撞车的时候他系了安全带，现在应该还活着。

en: Cars arrived there one after another.
zh: 车一辆接一辆地到了那儿。

en: We were stuck for hours in a traffic jam.
zh: 我们在路上堵了好几个小时。

en: I was late because my car broke down.

zh: 车坏了，所以我们只好走路了。

en: My car broke down, so I had to take a bus.
zh: 我车坏了，只好去坐公交。

en: Something must be wrong with our car; the engine is giving off smoke.
zh: 车肯定出毛病了，引擎都在冒烟。

en: The car broke down on the way to the airport.
zh: 车在去机场的路上坏了。

en: The car left a cloud of dust behind it.
zh: 车开过去带起了一阵尘土。

en: The car broke down, so they had to walk.
zh: 车坏了，所以他们只好走着去。

en: I heard a car stop in front of the house.
zh: 我听到有辆车在房子前面停下了。

en: She had a narrow escape when her car skidded off the road into a lake.
zh: 她的车打滑冲进湖里的时候，她真是死里逃生。

en: His car broke down in remote countryside.
zh: 他的车在偏僻的乡下坏了。

en: A car was coming in this direction.
zh: 有辆车朝这个方向开过来了。

en: There is ample room for another car.
zh: 那儿空间很大，还能再停一辆车。

en: Do you want a car?
zh: 你想要辆车吗？

en: The car hit the fence and turned over.
zh: 车撞到了围栏，翻了过去。

en: The car got stuck in the mud.
zh: 车陷进泥里了。

en: We couldn't go there because we didn't have a car.
zh: 因为没车，我们去不了那儿。

en: The car collided with a truck.
zh: 轿车和一辆大货车相撞了。

en: The car crashed into the truck.
zh: 那辆车撞上了一辆大卡车。

en: The car banged itself against a tree.
zh: 那辆车撞到了树上。

en: We shouldn't have any trouble if the traffic isn't too heavy.
zh: 如果不堵车的话，我们应该没问题。

en: I couldn't get out of my garage because there was a car in the way.
zh: 有辆车挡路，我车库都出不去了。

en: There's a car coming.
zh: 有辆车过来了。

en: They would have been killed if the car had gone over the cliff.
zh: 如果车掉下悬崖，他们肯定没命了。

en: They would've been killed if the car had gone over the cliff.
zh: 要是车翻下悬崖，他们就没命了。

en: They'd have been killed if the car had gone over the cliff.
zh: 要是车掉下悬崖，他们肯定活不了。

en: How I wish I had a car.
zh: 我多希望能有辆车啊。

en: We can go there with the help of a car.
zh: 有车的话，我们就能去那儿了。

en: If you have a car, you can come and go at will.
zh: 要是有辆车，你想去哪儿就去哪儿。

en: Why do you walk when you have a car?
zh: 你有车干嘛还走路啊？

en: I wish I had a car.
zh: 我要是有一辆车就好了。

en: A car cut in.
zh: 有辆车插进来了。

en: There is nothing to do but apologize.
zh: 除了道歉，没别的方法了。

en: Don't apologize.
zh: 别道歉。

en: There's no need to apologize.
zh: 没必要道歉。

en: She had the decency to apologize.
zh: 她还算懂事，道了歉。

en: You don't have to cover your mistake.
zh: 你没必要掩饰自己的错误。

en: I don't see any reason why I have to apologize.
zh: 我看不出我为什么要道歉。

en: I apologized, but even then she wouldn't speak to me.
zh: 我道歉了，但即便如此她还是不理我。

en: They talked about nothing but the news in the company.
zh: 除了公司里的新闻，他们什么也没聊。

en: Smoking in the office is against our rules.
zh: 办公室里禁止吸烟。

en: The president did not come, but sent the vice-president in his stead.
zh: 总裁没来，而是派了副总裁代他过来。

en: The boss gave us all a day off.
zh: 老板给我们大家都放了一天假。

en: The boss told his secretary to come up with a good idea by the end of the week.
zh: 老板让秘书在周末前想出一个好点子。

en: The president doesn't see anybody.
zh: 总裁谁也不见。

en: The president of the company bribed the government minister.
zh: 公司总裁贿赂了政府部长。

en: The president was sitting in the chair with his back to the window.
zh: 总裁背对着窗户坐在椅子上。

en: The president appointed a new manager.
zh: 总裁任命了一位新经理。

en: The company president has hired a headhunter to find us a new sales manager.
zh: 公司总裁请了个猎头帮我们找个新的销售经理。

en: The president instructed the employees to improve their productivity.
zh: 总裁要求员工提高生产力。

en: My boss is twice as old as I am.
zh: 我老板的年纪是我的两倍。

en: I hope my boss agrees to my plan.
zh: 我希望老板能同意我的计划。

en: My boss says one thing and means another.
zh: 我老板这人说话一套做一套。

en: Is the boss in a good mood today?
zh: 老板今天心情好吗？

en: The president held himself responsible for the slump in business, and left his post.
zh: 总裁为业绩下滑承担了责任，辞职了。

en: The president is out now.
zh: 总裁现在出去了。

en: The president assembled his advisers for a conference.
zh: 总裁召集了他的顾问们开会。

en: Our boss begrudged us even a small raise in pay.
zh: 老板连一点点工资都不舍得给我们涨。

en: The company president was indicted for paying kickbacks.
zh: 公司总裁因支付回扣被起诉了。

en: The boss gave Mike the ax for not coming to work on time.
zh: 老板因为迈克上班迟到把他给炒了。

en: The boss buzzed his secretary.
zh: 老板按铃叫了秘书。

en: Where's the president?
zh: 总裁在哪儿？

en: Where's the boss?
zh: 老板在哪儿？

en: The president gave up the idea because it was not practical.
zh: 总裁因为这个想法不切实际就放弃了。

en: The boss of our company is always on the go.
zh: 我们老板总是忙个不停。

en: The president was very serious about your overseas assignment.
zh: 总裁对你派驻海外的事很认真。

en: It came to the president like a bolt of lightning.
zh: 总裁脑子里突然灵光一现。

en: I'll put you through to the president.
zh: 我这就帮你把电话转给总裁。

en: I am highly honored by the presence of the president.
zh: 总裁的光临让我倍感荣幸。

en: After I said such a thing to my boss, I am certain to lose my job.
zh: 对老板说了那种话，我肯定要丢饭碗了。

en: The man talking with our boss is Hiroshi.
zh: 正在跟老板说话的那个人是宏。

en: The president and the secretary talked over a cup of coffee.
zh: 总裁和秘书一边喝咖啡一边聊天。

en: The president and his entourage were injured.
zh: 总裁和他的随行人员都受伤了。

en: We are subject to change our plans if the president disagrees.
zh: 如果总裁不同意，我们就得修改计划。

en: The boss ordered us to work from morning till night.
zh: 老板命令我们从早干到晚。

en: The news that the president was killed surprised them.
zh: 总裁遇害的消息让他们大吃一惊。

en: The boss praised you for your good work.
zh: 老板夸你活干得漂亮。

en: Social securities are not something that should be trifled with.
zh: 社会保障可不是闹着玩的。

en: Social security? Who do they think they're kidding.
zh: 社会保障？他们以为在耍谁呢？

en: The social welfare system is in bad need of renovation.
zh: 社会福利体系急需改革。

en: The bill was passed by a majority, although the Socialist Party was strongly opposed to it.
zh: 尽管社会党强烈反对，该法案还是以多数票通过了。

en: It is important to eliminate the social unrest.
zh: 消除社会动荡非常重要。
